definition: the ways of the world/the morals of the time
surname Shi
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: No, I was not mad, just slow to catch up with my life's 2)revisions.
sentences.chinese: 不，我没疯，只是没跟上世道的变化罢了。
“什么世道，”那男人嘀咕了一下。

sentences.english: Times are tough, and we have no present for you.
sentences.chinese: 世道艰难，我们没有生日礼物可以送给你。

sentences.english: And take action against injustice and unfairness in this world.
sentences.chinese: 敢于和不公正的世道进行斗争。

sentences.english: Mind does not understand why the morals have changed.
sentences.chinese: 心中百思不解，为何世道变了。

sentences.english: Once there were blacksmiths and there were steel workers, butthings change.
sentences.chinese: 过去的铁匠现在都变成钢铁工人了，世道总是在变的。

sentences.english: That’s how it always happens, my father says.
sentences.chinese: 世道总是如此，我父亲说。

definition: the men of today are sadly degenerated (idiom)
public morals are degenerating with each passing day (idiom)
affairs of life/things of the world
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
the hypocrisy of the world (idiom)
the notion in society that it's better to get ahead in the world by abandoning one's scruples than to suffer poverty/lit. despising poverty but not prostitution (idiom)
the world in chaos/troubled times/(in Buddhism) the mortal world
current situation/circumstances/current trend
public morals
moral bankruptcy/moral degeneracy
peace and prosperity (idiom)
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
world/earth
worldly affairs/the ways of the world
lit. the weak are prey to the strong (idiom); fig. predatory behavior/the law of the jungle
(literary) we/us
